gurmukhi: Bwjnih swj As gwj Bt AwvhIN ] kRoD kr boD hr joD As lwvhIN ]
transliteration: Bhaajnah(i) Saaj As Gadj Bhat Aav- Heen|| Krodh Dar Bodh Har Jodh As Laav- Heen||
translation: The warriors are coming being bedecked with their swords and on this side the Lord in his fury is recognizing the real fighters;

gurmukhi: jUJ rx Jwl biRx dyv pur pwvhIN ] jIq kY gIq kul rIq ijm gwvhIN ]383]
transliteration: Joojh Ran Dhaal Brin Dev Pur Paav- Heen|| Jit Kai Geet Kul Reet Jim Gadv- Heen||383||
translation: After fighting and getting wounded, the warriors leave for abode of gods and there they are welcomed with songs of victory.383.

gurmukhi: swj swj kY sBY slwj bIr DwvhIN ] jUJ jUJ kY mrY pRlok lok pwvhIN ]
transliteration: Saaj Saj Kai Sabhai Salaaj Beer Dhaav- Heen|| Joojh Joojh Kai Darai Pralok Lok Paav- Heen||
translation: All the warriors getting bedecked are falling upon the enemy and after fighting in the war; they reach heaven;

gurmukhi: Dwie Dwie kY hTI AGwie Gwie JylhIN ] pCyl pwv nw clYN Aryl bIr TylhIN ]384]
transliteration: Dhaae Dhaae Kai Hathiagjaae Ghaae Jhel- Heen|| Pachhel Paav Naa Chalaindarel Beer Thel- Heen||384||
translation: The persistent warriors run forward and endure the anguish of the wounds; their feet do not fall back and they are driving other warriors ahead.384.

gurmukhi: kop Ep dY sBY sroK sUr Dwie hYN ] Dwie jUJ hYN ArUJ jUJ jwie hYN ]
transliteration: Kop Op Kai Sabhai Darokh Soor Dhaae Hain|| Dhaae Dhaae Joojh Haindaroojh Joojh Jaae Hain||
translation: All the warriors are moving forward in anger and are embracing martyrdom in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: su AsqR SsqR myl kY pHwr Awn fwrhIN ] n Bwj gwj hY hTI inSMk Gwie mwrhIN ]385]
transliteration: Su Astra Shastra Mel Kai Prahaar Aan Daar- Heen|| Na Bhaaj Gadj Hai Hathi Nishank Ghaae Maar- Heen||385||
translation: Colliding their arms and weapons, they are striking blows and the stable warriors, who do not think of running away, are striking blows, persistently thundering fearlessly.385.

gurmukhi: miRdMg Fol bwsurI snwie JwNJ bwj hYN ] spwv rop kY blI skop Awn gwj hYN ]
transliteration: Mridan Dhol Baasurisanaae Jhaanjh Baaj Hain|| Sapaav Rop Kai Balisakop Aan Gadj Hain||
translation: The small and big drums, flutes, anklets etc. are creating sounds and the warriors firmly putting their feet on the earth are thundering angrily;

gurmukhi: ik bUJ bUJ kY hTI ArUJ Awn jUJ hYN ] su AMD DuMD huie rhI idsw ivsw n sUJ hYN ]386]
transliteration: Ki Boodhe Boodhe Kai Hathdaroojh Aan Joojh Haioo|| Su Andh Dhoundh Hue Rahidisaa Visaa Na Soojh Hain||386||
translation: The persistent warriors recognizing others are entangled with them and there is such a run in the battlefield that the directions are not being comprehended.386.

gurmukhi: suroK kwil kysrI sMGwr sYx Dwie hYN ] Agsq isMD kI ijmM pcwie sYn jwie hYN ]
transliteration: Surokh Kaal(i) Kesarisanhar Sain Dhaae Hain|| Agadt Sindh Kikiman Pachaae Sain Jaae Hain||
translation: The lion of the goddess Kali, in order to kill the army, is running angrily in this way and wants to destroy the army in this way just as the sage August had completely drunk the ocean;

gurmukhi: sMGwr bwhxIs ko AnIs qIr gwj hYN ] ibsyK ju`D mMf hYN AsyK SsqR bwj hYN ]387]
transliteration: Sanhaar Baahnees Ko Anees Teer Gadj Hain|| Bisekh Juddh Mand Hain Asekh Shastra Baaj Hain||387||
translation: After killing the forces, the warriors are thundering and in the dreadful fight, their weapons are colliding.387.

gurmukhi: Awvq hI niRp ky dl qy hir bwj krI rQ kotk kUty ] swj kry niRprwj khUM brbwj iPry ihhnwvq CUty ]
transliteration: Aavat Hinrip Ked Al Te Har(i) Baaj Karirath Kotak Koote|| Saaj Dare Nripaajkahoon Barbaaj Phire Hihnaavat Choote||
translation: On the arrival of the army of the king, the Lord (Kalki) chopped many elephants, horses and chariots; the horses bedecked by the king were roaming in the battlefield,

gurmukhi: qwt khUM gjrwj rxM Bt kysn qy gih kysn jUty ] paun smwn bhY kil bwn sBy Air bwdl sy cl PUty ]388]
transliteration: Taat Kahoon Gadraaj Ranan Bhat Kesan Te Gadh Desan Jeete|| Paoun Samaan Bhai Kal(i) Baan Sabhe Ar(i) Baadal Se Chal Phoote||388||
translation: Somewhere neighing and somewhere the elephant were seen running; the warriors catching the hair of one another were engaged in fight with them; the arrows were being discharged like the wind and with them; the arrows were being discharged like the wind an
